Canada, with 3 points, exited the tournament.
India vs Canada Group A game was washed out due to wet outfield
3 out of the 4 games in Florida have been abandoned due to rain
India progresses to the Super 8 as table toppers with the USA joining them in second place.
The match between Canada and India was abandoned due to a wet outfield without a ball being bowled.
India's last Group 'A' match against Canada was abandoned without a ball being bowled due to a wet outfield.
India finished on top of the group with 7 points and will face Afghanistan in its first Super 8 fixture at Barbados on June 20.
Arshdeep Singh has delivered six overs during the powerplay phase of this T20 World Cup and has allowed only a single boundary.
The match was called off due to wet conditions in the outfield of Central Broward Park & Broward County Stadium, Florida after rains and flash floods.
India finish the group stages with 7 points and at the top of the table while Canada finish with three points from four matches – having previously defeated Ireland.
India’s final Group A match at the 2024 T20 World Cup on Saturday was abandoned without a ball being bowled due to wet outfield, with both the teams awarded a point each.
India's confidence primarily stems from the pacers’ effort in three group matches. Lead quick Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Hardik Pandya and Mohammed Siraj combined to bag 20 wickets among them.
